keyTakeAways: Lance Bass has type 1.5 diabetes, also known as LADA (latent autoimmune diabetes of adulthood).
He uses the Dexcom G7 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System to track his blood sugar levels effectively.
He created an online persona called 'Blood Sugar Lance' on Instagram to educate people about diabetes with humor, which developed by accident.
Bass notes that certain foods, especially white rice and white bread, cause significant blood sugar spikes and must be avoided.
His uncle had type 1 diabetes, shaping his early understanding of the condition and the importance of dietary management.
He emphasizes how modern monitoring technology and peer support within the diabetic community have improved quality of life.
Stress from his busy career and parenting his four-year-old twins affects his blood sugar levels.
There is currently no official update on a potential *NSYNC reunion tour, and Lance Bass has dismissed recent claims as misinformation.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Lance Bass, former member of the boy band *NSYNC, shares his personal journey with type 1.5 diabetes (LADA), emphasizing how modern technology like the Dexcom G7 continuous glucose monitor has transformed his ability to manage the condition. He created the 'Blood Sugar Lance' Instagram persona to educate and entertain fans about diabetes with humor. He highlights that foods like white rice and white bread cause dangerous blood sugar spikes, and stresses the role of peer support and stress management in daily life. Although fans are hopeful for a *NSYNC reunion, Bass confirms there is no current plan, dismissing recent speculation as misinformation. The article underscores the importance of diabetes awareness, personal responsibility in dietary choices, and the impact of technology on quality of life.
title: Lance Bass has more to say about living with diabetes than he does about an *NSYNC reunion
